result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony, Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.
Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
*Restitution to be determined at a restitution hearing scheduled for 9-17-15 at 1:30 p.m.

**11-11-15/Rest. Hearing**
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

*Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

*Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job.
*Vocational assessment.
*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

*NO new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
*NO association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
*NO contact with 5328 W. Vliet Street.
*NO alcohol or controlled substances.
*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

*Cooperate with agent.
*Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
*Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: *60 days in the House of Corrections, with Huber releases privileges for work, subject to verification.  No electronic monitoring.  No good time release privileges.  Defendant to check into the House of Corrections on 8-10-15 at 5:00 p.m

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenard Deshawn Mathis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn for Defense:  Defendant, Kenard Deshawn Mathis.  Court ordered restitution to be set at ZERO.

Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered the stayed bench warrant withdrawn.  Court has not received all transcripts to conduct the Restitution Hearing.  Matter reset.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea Hearing conducted on July 6, 2015 received and filed.
Letter regarding Restitution submitted by Attorney David Kaiser received and filed.
Transcript of Restitution Hearing 10/22/15 received and filed.

Attorney David M. Kaiser in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Defendant needs to be present for testimony.  Defendant completed his underlying sentencing on October 9, 2015.  Victim appears and sworn:  Liam D.   Court issued a bench warrant, but STAYED the issuance of the bench warrant until next court date.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney David M. Kaiser in court, defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced for this hearing.  Defendant to be produced for next hearing.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney David M. Kaiser in court, defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Denying Motion for Modification of Sentence signed and filed.  Copy sent to Defendant and State.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence.

Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 26 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 14 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of  2  YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution to be determined at a restitution hearing scheduled for 9-17-15 at 1:30 p.m. 
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with 5328 W. Vliet Street
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Vocational assessment
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 60 days in the House of Corrections, with Huber releases privileges for work, subject to verification.  No electronic monitoring.  No good time release privileges.  Defendant to check into the House of Corrections on 8-10-15 at 5:00 p.m

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 
  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

As to Count 2 as amended: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.

Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Court amended the new information to reflect "Count 2".
Court ordered Count 2 amended to ATTEMPT BURGLARY (BUILDING OR DWELLING) - PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.10(1m)(a), 939.50(3)(f), 939.32, 939.05, a Class F Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties may have reached a resolution.

Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Parties awaiting additional discovery from the state.  Status date selected.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense awaiting discovery materials; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
FILED, NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Paul Hauer for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

AND/OR  the address of:  5328 West Vliet Street, City of Milwaukee

Defendant Kenard Deshawn Mathis in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
